I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
V: Type
f: union_map [ordType of nat] V

Goal:
is_true (fresh f \notin dom f)

Premises:
Notation union_map := UMDef.tp
is_true = eq^~ true : bool -> Prop Arguments is_true _%bool_scope is_true is a coercion
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
dom : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (cT : union_map_class K V), cT -> seq K
fresh = fun f : union_map [ordType of nat] V => (last_key f).+1 : union_map [ordType of nat] V -> nat
Notation ordType := Ordered.type
last_key_dom : forall f : union_map [ordType of nat] V, valid f -> last_key f \notin dom f -> f = Unit
dom_freshn : forall (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (n : nat), fresh f + n \notin dom f
allP : reflect {in ?s, forall x : ?T, ?a x} (all ?a ?s) where ?T : [V : Type f : union_map [ordType of nat] V |- eqType] ?a : [V : Type f : union_map [ordType of nat] V |- pred ?T] ?s : [V : Type f : union_map [ordType of nat] V |- seq ?T]
last_key_max : forall (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> x <= last_key f
dom_ordfresh : forall (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> x < fresh f
last_key = fun f : union_map [ordType of nat] V => last 0 (dom f) : union_map [ordType of nat] V -> nat
dom_last_key : forall f : union_map [ordType of nat] V, valid f -> ~~ empb f -> last_key f \in dom f
max_key_last : forall (f : union_map [ordType of nat] V) (x : [ordType of nat]), x \in dom f -> {in dom f, forall y : nat, y <= x} -> last_key f = x
hist_path : forall f : union_map [ordType of nat] V, path oleq 0 (dom f)
last_key_mono : forall f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V, {subset dom f1 <= dom f2} -> last_key f1 <= last_key f2
mem_seq1 : forall x y : ?T, (x \in [:: y]) = (x == y) where ?T : [V : Type f : union_map [ordType of nat] V |- eqType]
last_keyUnf : forall f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V, valid (f1 \+ f2) -> last_key f2 <= last_key (f1 \+ f2)
last_keyfUn : forall f1 f2 : union_map [ordType of nat] V, valid (f1 \+ f2) -> last_key f1 <= last_key (f1 \+ f2)
last_key0 = (fun _evar_0_ : last 0 (UM.dom (UMC.from UMC.empty)) = 0 => eq_ind_r (fun _pattern_value_ : seq [ordType of nat] => last 0 _pattern_value_ = 0) _evar_0_ (UMC.domE UMC.empty)) ((fun _evar_0_ : last 0 (UM.dom (UMC.from (UMC.to (UM.empty V (cond (union_mapUMC [ordType of nat] V)))))) = 0 => eq_ind_r (fun _pattern_value_ : union_mapUMC [ordType of nat] V => last 0 (UM.dom (UMC.from _pattern_value_)) = 0) _evar_0_ (UMC.emptyE (union_mapUMC [ordType of nat] V))) ((fun _evar_0_ : last 0 (UM.dom (UM.empty V (cond (union_mapUMC [ordType of nat] V)))) = ...
validEb : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f : U), reflect (valid f /\ (forall k : K, k \notin dom f)) (empb f)
validUnPtD : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (v : V) (f : U), valid (f \+ pts k v) -> k \notin dom f
validPtUnD : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (v : V) (f : U), valid (pts k v \+ f) -> k \notin dom f
dom_NNR : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f1 f2 : U), valid (f1 \+ f2) -> k \notin dom (f1 \+ f2) -> k \notin dom f2
dom_NNL : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f1 f2 : U), valid (f1 \+ f2) -> k \notin dom (f1 \+ f2) -> k \notin dom f1
Record finMap (K : ordType) (V : Type) : Type := FinMap { seq_of : seq (K * V); _ : is_true (sorted ord [seq key i | i <- seq_of]) } Arguments finMap _ _%type_scope Arguments FinMap [K] [V]%type_scope [seq_of]%seq_scope
validPtUn : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (v : V) (f : U), valid (pts k v \+ f) = [&& cond U k, valid f & k \notin dom f]
validUnPt : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (v : V) (f : U), valid (f \+ pts k v) = [&& cond U k, valid f & k \notin dom f]
dom_inNR : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f1 f2 : U), valid (f1 \+ f2) -> k \in dom f2 -> k \notin dom f1
dom_inNL : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f1 f2 : U), valid (f1 \+ f2) -> k \in dom f1 -> k \notin dom f2
valid_true : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U), valid f1 -> valid f2 -> (forall x : K, x \in dom f1 -> x \notin dom f2) -> validUn_spec f1 f2 true
UMC.domE : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f : U), dom f = UM.dom (UMC.from f)
Variant validUn_spec (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (f1 f2 : U) : bool -> Type := valid_false1 : ~~ valid f1 -> validUn_spec f1 f2 false | valid_false2 : ~~ valid f2 -> validUn_spec f1 f2 false | valid_false3 : forall k : K, k \in dom f1 -> k \in dom f2 -> validUn_spec f1 f2 false | valid_true : valid f1 ->...-> validUn_spec f1 f2 true Arguments validUn_spec [K] [V]%type_scope [U] _ _ _%bool_scope Arguments valid_false1 [K] [V]%type_scope [U f1] Arguments valid_false2 [K] [V]%type_scope [U] _ [f2] Arguments valid_false3 [K] [V]%type_scope [U f1 f2 k] Arguments valid_true [K] [V]%type_scope [U f1 f2] _ _ _%function_scope
Variant dom_find_spec (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f : U) : bool -> Type := dom_find_none' : find k f = None -> dom_find_spec k f false | dom_find_some' : forall v : V, find k f = Some v -> f = upd k v (free k f) -> dom_find_spec k f true Arguments dom_find_spec [K] [V]%type_scope [U] _ _ _%bool_scope Arguments dom_find_none' [K] [V]%type_scope [U k f] Arguments dom_find_some' [K] [V]%type_scope [U k f v]
dom_find : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (U : union_map_class K V) (k : K) (f : U), dom_find_spec k f (k \in dom f)
addn0 = fun n : nat => [eta eqP] ((fun _evar_0_ : (fun n0 : nat => is_true (n0 + 0 == n0)) 0 => (nat_ind (fun n0 : nat => n0 + 0 == n0) _evar_0_)^~ n) (eqxx 0) (fun n0 : nat => id)) : right_id 0 addn

```coq
intros.
assert (fresh f \notin dom f) as Hfresh.
{ apply dom_freshn with (n:=0). }
apply /is_trueP.
rewrite /is_true.
exact Hfresh.
Qed.

original: intros. assert (fresh f \notin dom f) as Hfresh. { apply dom_freshn with (n:=0). } apply /is_trueP. rewrite /is_true. apply Hfresh.
